body:
**What happened**:
Creation of dynamic volume failed using Kubernetes plugin. 
Volume successfully created and mounted when created by heketi-cli. The problem is most probably on Kubernetes side.

**What you expected to happen**:
Dynamic volume created and bound successfully on Kubernetes. 

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
1) Prepare configuration to Heketi API and storage class
2) Install Jupyterhub using helm.

Secret:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
metadata:
  name: heketi-secret
  namespace: default
type: "kubernetes.io/glusterfs"
data:
   key: Zfsfvddf1pbjEyMw==
---
Storage class:
apiVersion: storage.k8s.io/v1
kind: StorageClass
metadata:
  name: gfs-new
provisioner: kubernetes.io/glusterfs
parameters:
  resturl: "http://qpm-gluster01:8080"
  clusterid: "4f289422a2a7f083aefa1c6239653d98"
  restauthenabled: "true"
  restuser: "admin"
  secretNamespace: "default"
  secretName: "heketi-secret"
  volumetype: "replicate:2"

Jupyther hub PVC:
[root@qpm-k8s-master01 jupyterhub]# kubectl describe persistentvolumeclaims hub-db-dir

Namespace:     default
StorageClass:  gfs-new

Mounted By:    hub-6f94685b5d-qwnhf
